isis.stitle: TSI 97-13-02 - Back Tapered Clutching Teeth in Spicer Synchronized Transmissions

subjectgroup.subject: Back Tapered Clutching Teeth in Spicer Synchronized Transmissions

geninfo.para: The information supplied herein has been furnished by the manufacturer for use with its product. Navistar International Transportation Corp. reprints this information based on representations made to the Company by the manufacturer and is not responsible for any errors or mishaps resulting from such errors or from any misuse of the product. Every user is urged to carefully follow the instructions which accompany the product.

para.title: SPICER TRANSMISSION DIVISION SERVICE TOPICS NUMBER: 76

partsinfo.para: Backtapered Clutching Teeth In Spicer Medium Duty Synchronized Transmission.

Starting with serial number J960601000, all transmission models listed below ( Table 1) will feature backtapered clutching teeth in all gear positions except for 1st/Reverse. This document details the changes for each component, details part crossovers, and identifies replacement kits.

item.para: Increased shift engagement
Reduced shift effort
Better shift feel

partsinfo.para: The following is a list of transmission models affected by the backtaper program along with a cross reference between non-backtapered and backtapered Bills of Material.

svcproc.title: Detail Of Backtaper Improvements - Component By Component Review

svcsubproc.title: Mainshaft Gears And Drive Gears:

item.para: The clutch teeth are backtapered.

svcsubproc.para: How to identify a part as backtapered?

item.para: Part number is stamped on side of gears and on stem of drive gears.
The clutch teeth are backtapered and appear slightly dovetailed (see Figure 1).
A .005-.015 inch full-radius, groove is turned on the O.D. of gear tooth (see Figure 2).

figure.caption: Figure 1. Mainshaft Gears and Drive Gears
Figure 2. Mainshaft Gears and Drive Gears

svcsubproc.title: Clutch Gears And Mainshaft (Front Mainshaft In ES-7):

item.para: No gear locks.

svcsubproc.para: How to identify a part as backtapered?

item.para: Part number is stamped on side of clutch gears and end of mainshafts.
The spline teeth do not have gear locks (see Figure 3).

svcsubproc.title: Clutch Collar

item.para: The clutch teeth are backtapered.

svcsubproc.para: How to identify a part as backtapered?

item.para: Part number is stamped on side of clutch collars.
The clutch teeth are backtapered and have a bowtie appearance (see Figure 4).

svcsubproc.title: Shift Rail Assemblies:

item.para: The shift rail poppet notch was re-designed.
The poppet notches are extended; the notch no longer is positive stop.
The side poppet notch ramps are steeper, providing more resistance to unintentional shift rail movement.
The side notches are deeper to accommodate the steeper ramp angle.

svcsubproc.para: How to identify a part as backtapered?

item.para: Part number is etched on side of shift rail assembly.
The side poppet notches are wider and deeper (see Figure 5).

svcsubproc.title: Synchronizer Cups

item.para: The cups are deeper to provide a positive stop with clutch collars.

svcsubproc.para: How to identify a part as backtapered?

item.para: Part number is stamped inside cups.
There is a turned groove in the O.D. of cup cone (see Figure 6).

svcsubproc.title: Synchronizer Assemblies:

item.para: The cups are deeper.
The clutch collars are backtapered.

svcsubproc.para: How to identify a part as backtapered?

item.para: There is a turned grooved in the O.D. of cup cone (see Figure 6).
The clutch collar teeth are backtapered (see Figure 4).

svcsubproc.title: Poppet And Poppet Springs:

item.para: The poppet plungers were re-designed to bullet style, giving more spring support and more side support in poppet insert.
The springs were completely re-designed to accommodate the new poppet design.

svcsubproc.para: How to identify a part as backtapered?

item.para: The poppet plungers look like bullets.
The poppet springs sit inside the poppet plunger instead of around the stem (see Figure 5).

svcproc.title: Part Number Crossover
svcproc.para: Due to the nature of the backtapered clutching teeth, the straight toothed parts are NOT interchangeable with the backtapered parts.
For service, a straight toothed part MUST be replaced by a straight toothed part, and a backtaper part MUST be replaced by a backtaper part.

There are service kits available to replace groups of straight tooth parts with groups of backtaper components. These kits include both mainshaft gears, the synchronizer, the clutch gear, the shift rail assembly, the poppet plugger, instruction plate, and the poppet spring. Attach the instruction plate ( Figure 7) to the rear of the transmission using an output shaft bearing cap bolt as shown in Figure 8. The entire kit MUST be installed in the same unit. DO NOT mix backtaper parts with straight tooth parts. DO NOT order service parts from the Bill of Material on the transmission. Check the part number on the part itself before ordering. For example, a backtaper drive gear cannot service an old straight tooth transmission unless the other M/S gear, the synchronizer, the clutch gear, the shift rail assembly, the poppet plunger, and the poppet spring are switched out also.

note.para: Due to the design differences, mixing backtapered components and straight toothed components within the same rail position may cause premature failures.

svcproc.para: For any questions, contact Spicer Customer Support at 1-800-666-8688.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Attach Instruction Plate to Rear of Transmission

entry.para: Kits, same as except for drive gear, are available as: 101-35-22-3X, 101-35-24-3X, 101-35-25-3X
Kits, same as except for drivegear, are available as: 101-35-23-3X, 101-35-26-3X, 101-35-27-3X
Kits, same as except for drivegear, are available as: 49-35-17-4X, 49-35-19-3X, 49-35-21-3X, 49-35-23-3X, 49-35-18-3X, 49-35-20-3X and 49-35-22-3X
Kits, same as except for drivegear, are available as: 49-35-17-5X, 49-35-19-4X, 49-35-21-4X, 49-35-23-4X, 49-35-18-4X, 49-35-20-4X and 49-35-22-4X
